EB Khiyami | Technologist Cloud Architect Builder

I entered the software business by accident in 2000.

Since then, I have had multiple roles: technician, software developer, tech support, salesperson, system admin, network admin, and database admin. Later, I became an architect, manager, project manager, entrepreneur, and solution architect. I also have other roles: husband, father, investor, mentor, and others

Currently, I am employed at Amazon, where I support multiple teams: I’m an SME on Cloud Optimization, Migration and Modernization, Resiliency and a few other things… I enjoy building things and writing about them. Breaking down complex problems into manageable solutions and then documenting and sharing them comes naturally to me.

This website serves as a platform for me to share the things I build. Over time, the list of projects has grown quite long and doesn’t fit well on my LinkedIn profile page. Unless otherwise stated, all artifacts shared here are owned by my employer and represent their opinions.

People who work with me say I’m a good communicator. I can communicate complex topics in plain language. I can go deeply into subjects, but I’m just as comfortable discussing high-level business and technical concepts. They also say I’m an introvert. I speak only when necessary. If I go out with people, there has to be a very compelling reason for that.

I work only on things that I enjoy. If I’m working on something that I like, I may steal a few hours from weekends, nights, or bedtime to progress on it. Given that context, I’m not a typical 9-5 person, but also not a geek.

Education

Education-wise, I hold two master’s degrees in engineering. I’ve had to change my career every few years to keep up with new technology and trends. I’ve worked with companies of different sizes. I owned my own company at one point and I didn’t like it.
